snippet: Every Saturday and Sunday, 1,500 to 2,000 people arrive to climb Mission Peak in Fremont, Calif. However, there are only 42 parking spaces.
abstract: Mission Peak in Fremont, Calif, has become a favorite destination of hikers; every weekend 1,500 to 2,000 people come to climb it, but there are only 42 parking spaces; it is in a community of $2 million villas whose residents thought they were buying serenity, and now find hundreds of hikers parking along their streets; park district that oversees peak is considering fees and permits to limit access.
lead_paragraph: Every Saturday and Sunday, 1,500 to 2,000 people arrive to climb Mission Peak in Fremont, Calif. However, there are only 42 parking spaces.

headline.main: Challenge at Mission Peak: Finding a Place to Park
headline.print_headline: Challenge at Mission Peak: Finding a Place to Park
